name: Carousing
description: Carousing is a downtime activity where a character spends time making contacts, partying, and socializing. The character makes connections that could prove useful later.

squalid.description: 1 SP per day carousing in lower-class establishments

poor.description: 2 SP per day carousing in lower-class establishments

modest.description: 1 GP per day carousing in middle-class establishments

comfortable.description: 2 GP per day carousing in upper-class establishments

wealthy.description: 4 GP per day carousing in upper-class establishments

aristocratic.description: 10 GP per day carousing in aristocratic circles

resolution: After carousing for at least one workweek, the character makes a Charisma (Persuasion) check. The result determines the quality of contacts made.

results.result: The character makes a hostile contact who works against them -- a rival, a betrayed lover, or a framed innocent. The DM determines the specifics.
The character makes no useful contacts.
The character makes an allied contact. This contact provides no special benefit but is friendly.
The character makes a useful contact who will provide a favor or piece of information when asked.
The character makes an influential contact who will go out of their way to help.
